title: The Television Handbook.
subject: Television -- Production and direction$$QTelevision -- Production and direction -- Handbooks, manuals, etc
Television broadcasting$$QTelevision broadcasting -- Handbooks, manuals, etc
Télévision -- Production et réalisation$$QTélévision -- Production et réalisation -- Guides, manuels, etc

Television broadcasting
Television -- Production and direction
creator: Orlebar, Jeremy.$$QOrlebar, Jeremy.
description: The Television Handbook is a critical introduction to the practice and theory of television. The book examines the state of television today, explains how television is made and how production is organised, and discusses how critical thinking about programmes and genres can illuminate their meanings. This book also explores how developments in technology and the changing structure of the television industry will lead the medium in new directions. The Television Handbook gives practical advice on many aspects of programme making, from an initial programme idea through to shooting and the post-p.
contents: The Television Handbook; Copyright; Contents; The fill light; List of figures; Acknowledgements; Introduction; PART 1 TELEVISION IN TRANSITION; CHAPTER1 Television today; Television today; Convergence; Smart television; The content conundrum; YouView; CHAPTER2 Television regulation; Ofcom; Broadcasting code; Generally accepted standards; BBC Trust; Harm and offence; The watershed; Sex and violence; Bad language; Complaints; Television advertising; CHAPTER3 Public service broadcasting; The BBC; The PSB funding debate; News; Children's TV; PART 2 KEY CONCEPTS; CHAPTER4 Genre.

Where genre comes fromCrossing genre boundaries; Genre: the soap opera; Genre: the sitcom; Genre: the police series; Format; Shot selection and genre; Reworking the police and detective genre; Profile: Tony Garnett; Genre: the talk show; Genre: reality TV; CHAPTER5 Approaches to narrative; Defining narrative; Semiotics; Codes; Flow; Ideology; Narrative supports ideology; Realism; Identification and narrative; Viewers look at TV 'as a glance'; Structures in TV narratives; Hospital drama narratives; Sitcom narratives; Shot composition and narrative; POV.

CHAPTER6 Music television and postmodernismIntroduction; Postmodern music television; Postmodernism and the music video aesthetic; Celebrity culture; Features of postmodern television images; Origins of postmodern television styles; Video art; Politics, gender and performance; Music TV and globalisation; Media imperialism; History and the MTV debate; New developments in music television; CHAPTER7 Schedule and audience; Television in everyday life; Scheduling practices; Pre-echoes and echoes; The viewer as scheduler; Television for the family; Family and feminisation; Immediacy and intimacy.

The viewer as individual consumerActive audiences; Imaginary communities; PART 3 FACTUAL TELEVISION; CHAPTER8 Documentaries; Trust in documentaries; Notions of reality; Realism and social responsibility; Reflecting the nation; The impression of realism; Authenticity; Metonymy and accommodation in documentary; Documentary types: observational documentary; Documentary types: authored documentary; Documentary types: drama-documentary; Documentary types: docusoap; Documentary types: presenter-led documentary; Documentary types: the make over; Wildlife and current affairs; Music documentaries.

Postmodern factual televisionCHAPTER9 Reality TV; Reality TV today; Reality TV history; Programme profile: Crimewatch UK; Programme profile: Police, Camera, Action; Performance and reality TV; Reality TV and the identity of the medium; Boundaries between authenticity and performance; CHAPTER10 Making factual programmes; Documentary production; Getting a programme on the air: treatment; Commissioning; Preproduction; The researcher; Recce; Filming an interview; Setting up the camera for an interview; Location filming; The filming day; Cutaways; Postproduction; Commentary.
relation: $$Cform$$VPrint version: Orlebar, Jeremy. Television Handbook. Hoboken : Taylor & Francis, ©2011$$QTelevision Handbook.
